title: [Tutorials] Suggestions for the Sentiment Classifier tutorial

labels.name: type: documentation
labels.description: Improvements or additions to documentation

body:
There are some things to add that could be interesting:

1. TensorFlow gives some problems when running the code, so maybe we could add a warning saying that if people encounter problems when using TensorFlow, they can change to Pytorch.
2. Jupyter Notebook can encounter due to its widgets. If so, the line **!pip install ipywidgets** can solve this. This can be also added as a warning.
3. The dataset is quite big and it takes a long time to be loaded, so **"split = 'train[0:50]'"** can be added to the banking_ds variable.

title: [Tutorials] Issues with transformes in the SpaCy tutorial
body:
After importing space and loading the model, this error may be displayed:

**ValueError: [E002] Can't find factory for 'transformer' for language English (en). This usually happens when spaCy calls `nlp.create_pipe` with a custom component name that's not registered on the current language class. If you're using a Transformer, make sure to install 'spacy-transformers'. If you're using a custom component, make sure you've added the decorator `@Language.component` (for function components) or `@Language.factory` (for class components).**

In order to get rid of it, the following line could be added after importing Rubrix and installing SpaCy datasets:
**%pip install spacy-transformers -f https://download.pytorch.org/whl/torch_stable.html**

There are other suggestions (i.e. **%pip install spacy-transformers**), but sometimes it fails.

title: [UI] Fix: Text Classification annotation record width
body: fix #690

title: [Tutorial] Possible improvement in the "Clean labels using your model loss" tutorial
body:
After running the function for computing the loss in this tutorial, it is required to turn the dataset into a Pandas data frame. When running the code, the following warnings are shown:

**/var/folders/ym/p8klf4tx3cb_7q9vsngj0z4w0000gn/T/ipykernel_16926/2192143421.py:4: UserWarning: To copy construct from a tensor, it is recommended to use sourceTensor.clone().detach() or sourceTensor.clone().detach().requires_grad_(True), rather than torch.tensor(sourceTensor).**
**input_ids = torch.tensor(batch["input_ids"], device=device)/var/folders/ym/p8klf4tx3cb_7q9vsngj0z4w0000gn/T/ipykernel_16926/2192143421.py:5: UserWarning: To copy construct from a tensor, it is recommended to use sourceTensor.clone().detach() or sourceTensor.clone().detach().requires_grad_(True), rather than torch.tensor(sourceTensor).**
 **attention_mask = torch.tensor(batch["attention_mask"], device=device)
/var/folders/ym/p8klf4tx3cb_7q9vsngj0z4w0000gn/T/ipykernel_16926/2192143421.py:6: UserWarning: To copy construct from a tensor, it is recommended to use sourceTensor.clone().detach() or sourceTensor.clone().detach().requires_grad_(True), rather than torch.tensor(sourceTensor).
  labels = torch.tensor(batch["labels"], device=device)**

Therefore, these variables can be changed to:
    **input_ids = batch["input_ids"].clone().detach()**
    **attention_mask = batch["attention_mask"].clone().detach()**
    **labels = batch["labels"].clone().detach()**

Then, the warning disappears.

title: [Metrics] Normalize F1 metrics for Text-/TokenClassification
body:
Closes #648 

This PR replicates the f1 metric from the token classification task to the text classification task, that is it now includes also recall and precision.

title: [Labeling] Throw error when encountering duplicated rule names
body:
Closes #669 

In the end, I decided that it would be better to throw an error when encountering duplicated rule names as described in the linked issue. Most of the time when this happens, it's actually a mistake that you want to correct. I could not come up with a use case where you actually prefer a warning and which is not easily fixable in the user's code.

So now, if duplicated rule names are encountered, `WeakLabels` will throw a `DuplicatedRuleNameError` on init, mentioning the duplicated rule names.

title: [Metrics] input text length distribution for all task

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
It would be nice include a set of general metrics for every task. One of them could be the input text length distribution based on number of characters.

For text2text and token classification it's quite easy define the input target. But not sure how to define this metric over text classification inputs, since it could be a dictionary.

Make sense define a 2 level metric for text classification : 1) computing all input values (all dict values) and 2) one distribution per input key?

For example, if we have text classification records whose inputs are like:

```python
{
   "subject": "........",
   "body": "......."
}
```

The text length distribution computes the overall length  (`subject` content  + `body` content), the `subject` content length and the `body` content length separately.

@dcfidalgo @dvsrepo, any comment ???

title: fix(doc): prevent 'Mixed Content:...' error
body: Should fix #643

title: [Metrics] Simplify the API usage for `compute_for`

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

body:
I started testing the metrics for analysing training sets and I'd like to simplify how we set it for `Annotations` or `Predictions`. Currently:

```python
from rubrix.metrics.token_classification import entity_consistency
from rubrix.metrics.token_classification.metrics import Annotations

entity_consistency(name="conll2002_es", mentions=30, threshold=4, compute_for=Annotations).visualize()
```

I'd like at least to be able to do (avoiding `rubrix.metrics.token_classification.metrics`) :
```python
from rubrix.metrics.token_classification import entity_consistency, Annotations
```

I guess that using plain strings like "Annotations" might be problematic right?

but requested an insecurescript 'http://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/require.js/2.1.10/require.min.js'. 
This request has been blocked; the content must be served over HTTPS.

title: [enhancement] Control tqdm for batch, single or parallel logs
body:
When using for example:

```python
classifier = rb.monitor(classifier, dataset="tweets_en_es_emocion", sample_rate=1.0)
dataset.map(lambda r: {"prediction": classifier(r["text"])}, batch_size=32)
```

The progress bar and message become a bit annoying when rb.log is launched. I'd suggest providing a parameter to rb.log to disable the progress bar (and maybe the {n} records logged in... message) and use it at least in the rb.monitor methods to disable this logging. Of course any other idea is more than welcome!

title: Improve error message when WeakLabels gets no records
body:
When a query is provided to the `WeakLabels` object, that results in no records, the following error message is raised:
```python
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
IndexError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-28-3df95653c46d> in <module>
      3 
      4 # apply the rules to a dataset to obtain the weak labels
----> 5 weak_labels = WeakLabels(
      6     rules=rules,
      7     dataset="weak_supervision_yt",

~/recognai/rubrix/src/rubrix/labeling/text_classification/weak_labels.py in __init__(self, rules, dataset, ids, query, label2int)
     83             dataset, query=query, ids=ids, as_pandas=False
     84         )
---> 85         if self._records[0].multi_label:
     86             raise MultiLabelError(
     87                 "Multi-label text classification is not yet supported."

IndexError: list index out of range
```
I think this can be improved. 

@dvsrepo @frascuchon Do you think it would be useful to raise an error in `rb.load` if the loaded list/dataframe is empty? Or should we tackle this case downstream?

title: fix(monitoring): support old zeroshot versions
body:
This PR fetches zeroshot metadata in a more compatible way and check deprecated argument `multi_class`

Fixes #612

title: [UI] Fix: Mention values in Stats sidebar sort when updating
body: fix #605

title: rb monitor not logging for huggingface text classification and zeroshot pipelines

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
```python
from transformers import pipeline
​
classifier = pipeline("zero-shot-classification", 
                       model="Recognai/zeroshot_selectra_medium")
​
classifier = rb.monitor(task_model=classifier, dataset="zeroshot_mlsum", sample_rate=1.0)
​
classifier("Trump gana las elecciones", candidate_labels=candidate_labels, hypothesis_template=hypothesis_template)
```

title: [UI] Text classifier: annotation task interaction enhancement
body: fix #552

title: [Metrics] Add mention length metric at character level

labels.name: type: enhancement
labels.description: Indicates new feature requests

title: Add tqdm to `rb.log`
body:
This PR adds a progress bar to the `rb.log` method, and also prints out the URL where the dataset can be found.
I left a todo to improve our logging policy in the library, for now, it is a simple `print` ...

title: bugfixes(metrics): prevent index out of range for tokenclass metrics
body: Fixes #603 and maybe #596

title: feat(metrics): use stacked bar for entity consistency
body: Fixes #606

title: [bug] List index out of range in Token Classification log

labels.name: type: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behavior

body:
Not sure if it's a bug (or a tokenization problem), but I get this error (seems related to metrics):
```
brix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/middleware/gzip.py", line 35, in __call__
rubrix_1         |     await self.app(scope, receive, self.send_with_gzip)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/middleware/cors.py", line 78, in __call__
rubrix_1         |     await self.app(scope, receive, send)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/exceptions.py", line 82, in __call__
rubrix_1         |     raise exc from None
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/exceptions.py", line 71, in __call__
rubrix_1         |     await self.app(scope, receive, sender)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 566, in __call__
rubrix_1         |     await route.handle(scope, receive, send)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 227, in handle
rubrix_1         |     await self.app(scope, receive, send)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/routing.py", line 41, in app
rubrix_1         |     response = await func(request)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/fastapi/routing.py", line 202, in app
rubrix_1         |     dependant=dependant, values=values, is_coroutine=is_coroutine
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/fastapi/routing.py", line 150, in run_endpoint_function
rubrix_1         |     return await run_in_threadpool(dependant.call, **values)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/starlette/concurrency.py", line 34, in run_in_threadpool
rubrix_1         |     return await loop.run_in_executor(None, func, *args)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/concurrent/futures/thread.py", line 57, in run
rubrix_1         |     result = self.fn(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/rubrix/server/tasks/token_classification/api/api.py", line 94, in bulk_records
rubrix_1         |     records=bulk.records,
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/rubrix/server/tasks/token_classification/service/service.py", line 101, in add_records
rubrix_1         |     self.__metrics__.build_records_metrics(dataset, records)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/rubrix/server/tasks/commons/metrics/service.py", line 98, in build_records_metrics
rubrix_1         |     record.metrics = metrics.record_metrics(record)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/rubrix/server/tasks/token_classification/metrics.py", line 275, in record_metrics
rubrix_1         |     chars2tokens = cls.build_chars2tokens_map(record)
rubrix_1         |   File "/usr/local/lib/python3.7/site-packages/rubrix/server/tasks/token_classification/metrics.py", line 244, in build_chars2tokens_map
rubrix_1         |     and char == record.tokens[current_token + 1][0]
rubrix_1         | IndexError: list index out of range
```
When logging this record:

```python
TokenClassificationRecord(
text="'Secret Story : Última hora' debuta con un pobre 8.7% en el access de Telecinco.. . PROGRAMAS CON MEJOR CUOTA DEL LUNES (POR CADENAS). . ", 
  tokens=["'", 'Secret', 'Story', ':', 'Última', 'hora', "'", 'debuta', 'con', 'un', 'pobre', '8.7%', 'en', 'el', 'access', 'de', 'Telecinco', '..', '.', 'PROGRAMAS', 'CON', 'MEJOR', 'CUOTA', 'DEL', 'LUNES', '(', 'POR', 'CADENAS', ')', '.', '.'], 
  prediction=[('ENG', 60, 66)], 
  annotation=None, 
  prediction_agent=None, 
  annotation_agent=None,
   id=None, 
  metadata={'section': 'television', 'newspaper': 'eldiario'}, 
  status='Default', 
  event_timestamp=None
)

```
